promotion.promotion_step1_1: Visit Google Tag Manager Website (https://tagmanager.google.com/) and Log in with your Google account
promotion.promotion_step1_2: Click "Create Account" and Follow the Instructions to Fill in the Relevant Information
promotion.promotion_step1_3: Create a New Container under your GTM account
promotion.promotion_step1_GTM_title: Create Google Tag Manager account and container
promotion.promotion_step2_1: Follow the GTM instructions to copy your GTM container code (two pieces of code)
promotion.promotion_step2_2: Add the first code snippet to the <head> tag of every page on your website
promotion.promotion_step2_3: Add the second code snippet at the beginning of the <body> tag (after the tag)

promotion.promotion_step2_title: Add GTAG code to your website
promotion.promotion_step3_1: Log in to Google Tag Manager
promotion.promotion_step3_2: Go to the Container You Created
promotion.promotion_step3_3: Click 'New' in the 'Tags' section to add a new tag
promotion.promotion_step3_4: Select the tag type you want to add (e.g., Google Analytics)
promotion.promotion_step3_5: Configure the tag details (e.g., tracking ID for Google Analytics)
promotion.promotion_step3_6: In the "Trigger" section, select when to apply the tag (e.g., all pages)
promotion.promotion_step4_1: In the GTM interface, click the "Submit" button
promotion.promotion_step4_2: Add a version description and click "Publish" to apply the changes
promotion.promotion_step5_1: Ensure the GTM container code is already loaded on your website pages
promotion.promotion_step5_2: Test If Your Tag Triggers on the Correct Pages

promotion.promotion_step_kwai: Kwai backend screenshot tutorial: Capture entry points during third-party integration

promotion.tiktok_real_operation: Get and bind TikTok Pixel ID
promotion.tiktok_step1_title_1: Open the TikTok Ads Manager, find 'Tools' in the navigation bar, then click 'Events' in the dropdown menu.
promotion.tiktok_step2_title_2: After entering the Events Manager platform, click on 'Website Events'.
promotion.tiktok_step3_title_3: Click the 'Set Up Web Events' button on the Website Pixel page.
promotion.tiktok_step4_title_4: Select 'Manual Setup' and name your Pixel.
promotion.tiktok_step5_title_5: Enter the funnel event setup, then click 'Skip Step' to proceed to the next step.
promotion.tiktok_step6_title_6: During the parameter addition step, click 'Custom Code' and proceed to the next step.
promotion.tiktok_step7_title_7: On the setup completion page, click 'Cancel' to finish creation. (At this point, the setup is already complete. During testing, it was found that the 'Next' button could not be clicked, so 'Cancel' was clicked directly).
promotion.tiktok_step8_title_8: Return to the Website Events page, find the Pixel ID you need, and right-click to copy it.

system.1tips: Fiat to Crypto Exchange: Users can use fiat currency to buy cryptocurrency in the wallet, calculated based on real-time exchange rates. Crypto to Fiat Exchange: Users can use cryptocurrency to buy fiat currency in the wallet, calculated based on real-time exchange rates. Fiat-Crypto Conversion: Users can use cryptocurrency to buy fiat currency or use fiat currency to buy cryptocurrency in the wallet, calculated based on real-time exchange rates. Disable Feature: The currency exchange feature is hidden on the client-side.

system.system_limit_info1: 1. More domains are not always better: Each domain at a node needs to test network quality, and then the domains are ranked based on the network quality. If there are too many domain names at a node, each inspection will waste 1-2 seconds for speed testing, which may lead to network lag. It is recommended to limit the number of domains per node for each function to 2-10.
system.system_limit_info2: 2. How to handle too many old domains? For domains that were previously used or are old, it is recommended to use URL forwarding. This not only preserves the domain authority but also allows for unlimited redirection.
system.system_limit_info2_1: (1) Site Backend Operation Method: Batch select domains → Batch disable (wait 5-10 minutes for the changes to take effect) → Then batch delete the domains.
system.system_limit_info2_2: (2) Domain Registrar Backend Operation Method: Change the DNS to the registrar's default (e.g., GoDaddy Premium DNS), then select the domain and batch set forwarding.
system.system_limit_info3: 3. Suggested Backup Domains: These are domains that are not yet in use. It is recommended to add them only to the main domain without enabling resolution to avoid them being intercepted, hijacked, blocked, or restricted before activation. When needed, you can add them to the respective functional modules for use.
system.system_limit_info4_1: (1) Domain Resolution: 5 USDT per unit (first 30 free, additional charges apply for each extra unit)
system.system_limit_info4_2: 2) Traffic Fee: 0.3 USDT per 1Gb (first 500GB free, additional charges apply for each extra 1GB)
system.system_limit_info4_3: (3) Node Fee: 300 USDT per unit (3 nodes provided for free, charges apply only for additional nodes)
system.system_limit_info5: 5. Reason for recommending A8 in Mainland China: The best node for the Mainland market is A8 (Yabo exclusive node), as it is specifically optimized for Mainland China, offering significantly faster speeds. It doesn't experience lag during peak times, unlike other nodes which may occasionally have brief delays. Therefore, it is recommended to enable A8 more frequently in Mainland China.
